snippet: A steroid drug tainted with a fungus has been recalled in a meningitis outbreak, but more cases are expected, even as experts examine why only a fraction of the people exposed have fallen ill.
abstract: Doctors are working to understand why some patients treated with a fungus-tainted steroid drug that caused a national meningitis outbreak have become ill while others have not; one factor may be whether the needle used to administer the drug, which is commonly injected near the spine, pierced the spinal membrane, allowing the fungus into the spinal fluid.
lead_paragraph: A steroid drug tainted with a fungus has been recalled in a meningitis outbreak, but more cases are expected, even as experts examine why only a fraction of the people exposed have fallen ill.
